results.title: Shadowlands
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Brian Eastman and Spelling Films International
results.brief_description:
Shadowlands is an absorbing and moving story of true love. British writer C. S. Lewis, whose comfortable but rigid life as an Oxford don in the 1950’s is shaken by his meeting with a forthright poet, American Joy Gresham. She knew him from his books and he remembered her from her letters, but when they finally met, she was unlike any-one he had ever known. Like his writings, his love for Joy is captivating and magical. A story for everyone, made with uncommon intelligence and restraint.
Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger and Julian Fellowes

results.title: Death and the maiden
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Josh Kramer, Thom Mount and Behind the Scenes
results.brief_description: What if you had the chance to seek revenge for the crimes committed against you? Paulina Escobar (Sigourney Weaver), is faced with this moral dilemma when she confronts who she believes was her tormentor; a sadistic doctor who subjected her to physical, sexual and mental abuse 15 years ago when she was held hostage by South American Government interrogators. Paulina leads a quiet and nervous lifestyle with her husband (Stuart Wilson). This shaky semblance of peace is disrupted when her husband is brought home by a good Samaritan (Ben Kingsley) when his car breaks down during a storm. Alarm bells ring when Paulina recognises the voice from her blindfolded ordeal. Her husband is not convinced he is the offender and as a lawyer is challenged by her to present a case against the conviction.

results.title: Who framed Roger Rabbit?
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Frank Marshall, Robert Watts, Amblin Entertainment and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A magical blend of live-acting and animation that comes off brilliantly due to the super effort by Bob Hoskins in playing to imaginary “co-stars” who were drawn in later. Hoskins plays Eddie Valiant, a has-been gumshoe in the ‘40s film noir mould who comes out of a self enforced retirement. Someone is out to steal Toon Town from the cartoon characters who inhabit the magical land. To get their hands on the valuable property they frame its biggest star, Roger Rabbit for murder. Detective Valiant must solve the case and save the toons. Cast also includes Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy, Stubby Kaye and Charles Fleisher. Based on the story “Who censored Roger Rabbit?” by Gary K. Wolf and winner of four Academy Awards.

results.title: Lightning Jack
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Greg Coote, Paul Hogan, Village Roadshow Pictures and Lightning Ridge
results.brief_description: Paul Hogan is Lightning Jack Kane, an outlaw of legendary status, a bank robber who can shoot the eye out of a needle at 50 paces, a gunfighter quicker on the draw than Wyatt Earp and Doc Holliday - if only everyone else knew it! Co-starring Cuba Gooding Jnr as his mute sidekick and Beverly D’Angelo as the sultry saloon Madam, this is a comedy about two outlaws who just wanted to be wanted. This film is unique as it was the first Hollywood production to be floated on the stock market to raise the necessary production funds, with investors reaping a percentage of the profits, which unfortunately were not as much as expected.

results.title: Evita [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Robert Stigwood, Dirty Hands and Cinergi Pictres
results.brief_description: In her award winning role, pop icon Madonna shines as Eva Peron, legendary wife of Argentinian President Juan Peron. Her desperate ambition to climb to the top saw her trade her only assets for one shot at power and fame. Co-starring Antonio Banderas and Jonathan Price, this is the epic true story of the charismatic yet controversial, devoted yet ruthless, deprived yet triumphant Evita. Screenplay by Alan Parker and Oliver Stone and music by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice.

results.title: Serial Mom
results.creator_credit: John Waters, Mark Tarlov, John Fiedler and Polar Entertainment
results.brief_description: A combination of Mrs Brady and Murphy Brown, Beverly Sutphin (Kathleen Turner) is fiercely protective of her family, she will do anything to ensure their happiness, anything! She’s an active member of the PTA, a devoted wife to her dentist husband and a great housekeeper. She is “Super Mom”. Still waters, however, run deep and beneath the surface lies a multitude of secrets. Mom isn’t all she’s cracked up to be. Her son’s teacher suddenly disappears after recommending therapy for the boy to deal with his obsession for gore. Her daughter’s boyfriend winds up dead after he fails to call her when he said he would. The one of Dad’s patients forgets to floss and pays the ultimate price.

results.title: The Astonished heart
results.creator_credit: Terence Fisher, Antony Darnborough and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Noel Coward appears in this film he adapted from one of the nine one-act plays that make up the repertoire of his 1936 “Tonight at 8.30”. This repertoire included a diverse mix of song, dance and drama and was presented as a triple bill to showcase the talents of Coward and Gertrude Lawrence. This film concerns the emotional upheaval experienced by three friends who attempt to solve the problem by intellect. Psychiatrist Dr Christian Faber (Noel Coward) and his wife, Barbara (Celia Johnson) have begun to take each other for granted in their marriage. Christian begins an affair with Barbara’s best friend Leonora (Margaret Leighton). The affair is discovered by Barbara and the three avoid hurting one another over the issue. Christian is affected more deeply however, viewing his actions as a failure to meet his own moral and professional standards. Also starring Joyce Carey, Graham Payne, Amy Veness, Ralph Michael and Michael Hordern. Noel Coward also composed the musical score.

results.title: This sporting life
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Karel Reisz and Independent Artists (GB)
results.brief_description: Richard Harris gives a superb performance as Yorkshire coal miner Frank Machin, who dreams of achieving public acclaim by making a name for himself on the City Rugby team. He performs with tenacity and aggressiveness and earns a place on the team as well as 1000 pounds. His desire of being well liked extends to his personal life as he seeks the approval and affections of his widowed landlady Mrs Hammond (Rachel Roberts). After initial resistance the two become lovers and it is at this physical level that their relationship remains. When Frank’s friend marries, Mrs Hammond is racked with bitterness about her relationship and Frank responds in the only way he knows how, with violence. As tragedy strikes, Frank is left only with his sporting life. Also starring Colin Blakely, Alan Badel and William Hartnell and adapted by David Storey from his own novel.

results.title: Little Odessa
results.creator_credit: James Gray, Paul Webster and Immigrant Pictures (US)
results.brief_description: A Jewish-Russian hitman, Joshua Shapira (Tim Roth) returns to his family in Brighton Beach, New York, on a job. The town is referred to as ‘Little Odessa’, so called because of the influence of the Russian mob. Joshua is not a welcome presence as he disappeared in disgrace years ago for his reputation as a hitman, only his younger brother Reuben (Edward Furlong) and terminally ill mother (Vanessa Redgrave) welcome his presence. Joshua must lay low as rumours spread around of his arrival and neither Joshua or his familyn are safe from the violence that’s brewing in Little Odessa. Cast also includes Maximilian Schell, Moira Kelly and Paul Guilfoyle.

results.title: The Scarlet letter
results.creator_credit: Roland Joffe, Moving Pictures, Cinergi, Allied Artists Pictures and Lightmotive
results.brief_description: Demi Moore stars as Hester Prynne, a sensual, spirited young woman who arrives in a small Puritan town in New England to prepare a home for the upcoming arrival of her husband. There she meets the sensitive and appealing town minister, Rev. Dimmesdale (Gary Oldman), with whom she shares an undeniable attraction. When events soon reveal that Hester’s husband has been attacked by Indians and is presumed dead, neither Hester nor Dimmesdale can suppress their feelings anymore and a forbidden affair ignites. Upon discovering Hester is pregnant, the intolerant townspeople brand her an adulteress and, when she refuses to reveal the identity of her lover, they force her to wear a scarlet letter “A” on her dress as a brand of shame. Loosely based on the novel by Nathaniel Hawthorne.
